title: I enjoy playing Senna. Senna highlights a massive problem with the enchanter roster

replies.body:
Soraka's been reworked since Nami.
Karma has been reworked since Nami.
Janna has been reworked since Nami.

Rakan was released. 
Yuumi was released. 
Bard was released.

P.S. Nami has really complex play. She's not "boring >.>"

P.P.S Senna's R is not wide damage wise, and the damage is sub average on it.

> [{quoted}](name=Illabethe,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=kpXGrHl9,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2019-12-26T20:47:43.072+0000)
>
> Soraka's been reworked since Nami.

Glorified gutting and simplification of the champion (no sweet spot on Q and doesn't heal in relation to the amount of people you hit anymore)

> Karma has been reworked since Nami.

PFFFFFT

> Janna has been reworked since Nami.

See Soraka
 
> Rakan was released. 

Catcher

> Yuumi was released. 

7 years for ONE ATTEMPT.

> Bard was released.

Catcher
 
> P.S. Nami has really complex play. She's not "boring >.>"

No she doesn't. She's incredibly simple to understand as a champion.
 
> P.P.S Senna's R is not wide damage wise, and the damage is sub average on it.

Still way more interesting as a move in comparison to literally any enchanter in the game.

Soraka:

V3.14 Reworked 

V4.17 Reworked again.

Both very different kits from current.

-------------------

Karma was simplified. All abilities boosted to compensate.

------------------

Janna's rework is MUCH stronger and actually puts her into the game instead of being a bot.

V7.19 

-----------
Rakan is a dual class, and has both a shield AND an aoe heal..... Also shields SELF.

----------

Bard literally has 2 enchanter functions: Stasis + Sit around to use heal. 

------------

You dismissing Nami as simple just tells me your actual credibility level. Her kit is simple. Using it correctly and in an advanced manner is not. I can do 11 actions per 1.5 seconds on her. I guarantee you can't. I can also solo Assassins on her.

----------

Because speed doubling waves, and Book, are not interesting.

Varies based on the Assassin. 

Evelynn: Goal is to self Bubble, and heal as soon as her E animation begins. If you do, you will disrupt her W viability, heal out of a 80% damage hit, and all she has left is her Q and R, and her Q is in no position to outtrade/kill you and R won't execute. If she doesn't escape, she's dead. If she tries to chase and do it again, you can bait her into a bush since she has no nontarget dashes.

Zed: Tougher. Might need some armor items, or and if a Novice a Zhonya's. You can dodge shadows, so keep moving. If he manages 60% of your HP, heal, but save Q and R for after he has used his Living Shadows, or he will just shadow through the CC. If you go into this fight expecting him to outtrade you and play the first half defensively to just survive his R, you can win. If you're scared of R and try to pre-empt it, you'll usually die.

Talon: Just predict where he will have to run when he R's. Move in a perpendicular motion from where he R's or Q's as to avoid Bleed procs. If you can land a bubble after he has failed a Q, it's your trade.

Qiyana/Akali: Just wait until they shroud, and track their visibility. If you learn to spot stealth shimmers, you can land CC even in their protected status, and if you can waste their time using their unpredictability, you can force a trade when they are visible. If Akali lands an E, make sure to save a self Q for if she begins the dash animation, Cast R in her direction, and you will have a secure 3-4 second stun, and she will be lower on mana. If she has R still, you might lose this one, or just use the CC to escape and reset.

Fizz Diana Ekko: Build Resists. They won't 1 shot and you will easily heal out.

> [{quoted}](name=Illabethe,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=kpXGrHl9,comment-id=000000000000,timestamp=2019-12-26T21:17:56.480+0000)
>
> Soraka:
> 
> V3.14 Reworked 

> V4.17 Reworked again.

...aight, you're not understanding the point of this thread when you say this.

The only *significantly different kit* Soraka's had is the one where she granted people bonus mr, armor, and mana while shredding enemy magic resist. They reworked her to remove those abilities and she's been *largely the same heal bot* since. Even if we wanted to give Soraka the second "rework", that's still 5 years since Riot's said "Hey, let's TRY to make an enchanter kit that isn't the same old shit slapped together slightly differently".
 

> Karma was simplified. All abilities boosted to compensate.

They're all boring as hell. Karma mains have been complaining about it for so long they got bored of doing so. The primary complaint I see about Karma *to this day* when it comes from people that dislike this iteration is how *boring* it is. The point is that they changed the champions from being overbearing way back in the day and never came back to the sub-class to make them *interesting* after gutting all their kits from what they used to be.

> Janna's rework is MUCH stronger and actually puts her into the game instead of being a bot.

You have NO IDEA what Janna used to be able to do if you think this. E on a way shorter cd? Passive movement speed in all directions? Higher values on her E and R? Janna spent much of season 6 getting chain nerfed until they were forced to "rework" her to gut her, then had to nerf her some more. Janna's a shell of what she once was if you're talking about pure effectiveness in the game.

> Rakan is a dual class

Just because you have a heal, doesn't mean you're an enchanter. Alistar is not an enchanter, no? Rakan is not a defensive champion. He makes picks and plays. If anything, he's *most vulnerable* when used defensively, as he's forced to clump with allies while being fired on by aoes if he wants to shield or heal them. He's a catcher.

> Bard literally has 2 enchanter functions: Stasis

WHEN HAS STASIS BEEN AN ENCHANTER-SPECIFIC FUNCTION TO MAKE THIS CLAIM?

And as for the heal: His healing is just a laning tool at best. After laning it's more a MS tool for catching people than it is a heal.

> You dismissing Nami as simple just tells me your actual credibility level.

1.4 million mastery on the champion and 2.6 million on Sona.

> Because speed doubling waves, and Book, are not interesting.

Nami's ult is "OK", actually. Doesn't excuse Riot being this lazy with the class after making the champion in 2012, but I wouldn't complain about Nami's ult specifically. Yuumi's ult is pretty boring, but at least her W's something different. None of it excuses how lazy they've been with addressing the rest of the sub-class when they double-triple-quadra dip into marksmen and juggernauts *over and over and over* again for the past few years, now. The game doesn't even need this many marksmen in it since they all do the same shit, anyway, but they're infatuated with making them. All I'm asking for is for some effort.
Bard isn't an enchanter, karma wasn't really reworked as much as she was objectively obliterated having everything that made her unique and cool taken away.

sounds more like enchanters are personally not your cup of tea, and not that enchanters as a concept are flawed.  Takes a certain type of person to have fun playing a character whose main role is existing primarily to make others better.

Also, two champions can have the same role and function, yet play and feel completely different(your Vi and Camille comparison is a stretch and one doesn't NULLIFY the other)

Champions are roles sure, but they're also characters.  Even though Fiora is best at splitpushing, and an AoE heal forr a good ult isn't the most efficient thing for her, it makes sense and feels right on a character-driven, lore-based level.

A hyper-carry like Kayle is also an angel of justice and protection so her having a couple skills that can target herself AND allies isn't misplaced by any means

All that being said, I think it's pretty dumb Senna is shoe-horned as an "enchanter" which she logically isn't, just because it's the closest existing category for her.

> [{quoted}](name=Keiaga,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=kpXGrHl9,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2019-12-26T22:01:02.093+0000)
>
> sounds more like enchanters are personally not your cup of tea, and not that enchanters as a concept are flawed.  Takes a certain type of person to have fun playing a character whose main role is existing primarily to make others better.

Sounds like someone else didn't read much of the original post if that's your paragraph in your response, and that's just me being honest.

> Also, two champions can have the same role and function, yet play and feel completely different(your Vi and Camille comparison is a stretch and one doesn't NULLIFY the other)

What's Vi good for? Everything Vi does, Camille does better.

Chasing? Cam has more distance.

Lock down? Cam's is longer.

Beating down tanks? Cam has true damage on a low cd vs. Vi's cute little W that doesn't even have an active.

Shield passive? Cam gets double the scaling value (20% vs. 10%) vs. the type of target she's facing so it's just bona-fide better.

Outside of Riot tuning numbers, why would I EVER want Vi over Cam? Vi is trash.
 
> Champions are roles sure, but they're also characters.  Even though Fiora is best at splitpushing, and an AoE heal forr a good ult isn't the most efficient thing for her, it makes sense and feels right on a character-driven, lore-based level.

...there's plenty of other benefits you could gain for stabbing up your target than an aoe heal. An *single target heal to herself,* for example? Maybe boosted stats for a small period? I'm not even super mad about Fiora having the heal, but it shows how little they think of making enchanters more exciting in comparison to damn near any other class in the game. They hardly even bother trying to begin with.
 
> A hyper-carry like Kayle is also an angel of justice...

*THAT ISN'T EVEN THE POINT.* You can be an "angel of law and order" in a *myriad of ways* that can fit "hyper carry" more than **targeted invincibility** of all things. And, once again, even if we just leave it as it is, why is it that she gets THAT and enchanters get shit like "A slightly more powerful version of my Q skill shot" or "A line stun...that's literally it" or "a knock back with a heal tacked onto it". It's all so incredibly basic.

Personally, I don't even like Kayle's ult, but it makes the case of "Why are we putting these support-like effects on carry ultimates?"
Your incapability, or refusal to fully comprehend a differing opinion is astounding.

> [{quoted}](name=Keiaga,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=kpXGrHl9,comment-id=000200000000,timestamp=2019-12-26T22:47:17.178+0000)
>
> Your incapability, or refusal to fully comprehend a differing opinion is astounding.

Here's the thing: I read what you said and responded. You didn't have a rebuttal for misunderstanding the point of the thread when being called out for saying "Chipndip1 doesn't like enchanters", saying "Vi has a purpose in this game", or for not understanding the fact that the point of this thread is that *there's plenty of ways to make enchanters more exciting even if they aren't beating people upside the head with 750 ap if we just put our thinking caps on to think up some stuff for them to do instead of just heal/shield spamming.*

Cleansing cc? GP, a carry, can, but no enchanter can. Blocking AAs? That's on Jax and Shen. Blocking skill shots? Braum and Yasuo. Invincibility? Taric's got some...and he kinda dips in to the enchanter play style, so we'll give Riot 1/2 a point for it. But the point is, and I'ma bold this so we're on the same page, that **Riot hasn't put much effort into designing kits for champions that are PRIMARILY ENCHANTERS that are exciting or new, whether that's reworks or new kits. Most of them fall back into the same trappings, with similar strengths, weaknesses, and play styles. It's boring.** Even Yuumi is now being pushed this way more and more because the Garen/Yuumi strat is really fucking toxic to deal with.

Once again, it's not that enchanters are icky, otherwise I wouldn't have a combined total of 4 million mastery between two of them. It's that Riot's hardly innovating in that space unless they make it a "enchanter splash on a warden/marksman/whatever kit" like they did Taric and now Senna. That's the point of the thread.

You sure write a lot for someone with nothing to say.  Each enchanter has their own flavor to make them stand out from the others as far as their general role of "buff and support teammates" goes.  That's their thing, and even someone who doesn't play enchanters can appreciate that.  It's strange that you'd put in the time to get 4mil mastery on a couple of champs you don't even have a proper appreciation for but that's not my place to judge.  

Not even going to get into the concept that champions don't have to be 100% min/maxed into maximum efficiency for their role because I already know that's just out of your grasp.

But hey, good luck on getting another million mastery points on a champ you hate.

> [{quoted}](name=Keiaga,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=kpXGrHl9,comment-id=00020000000000000000,timestamp=2019-12-26T23:27:04.408+0000)
>
> You sure write a lot for someone with nothing to say.  

You're the one that replied to my whole response to you with a singular sentence, and you're telling me *I have nothing to say?*

You're the one that got offended at me saying Vi's just worse Camille **because Vi doesn't have a single function in the game that Camille doesn't have** and you're saying I have nothing to say when you haven't told me how Vi isn't worthless yet?

You're the one that can't comprehend the point of the thread in the first place and I'm the one that has nothing to say?

You bring up a subject, and when there's slight push back on said subject, you drop it like you're being robbed. If you have no conviction in what you're saying, why are you saying it?

Good luck in not coming back to this thread until you have something worth saying in it, honestly.
If you don't enjoy play enchanters, don't do it lol

> [{quoted}](name=Love Anastasia,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=kpXGrHl9,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2019-12-26T20:59:40.110+0000)
>
> If you don't enjoy play enchanters, don't do it lol

Sounds like you read the first sentenced and came to the comments section.

Ok first things first. Senna (and pyke for that matter) are not supports. When your main function is building either Lethality or Crit. You are not a support.

Just because you build a support item first and dont CS in the bot lane, does not mean your champ is a support. You are playing something else in the support role. 

So I dont feel it is fair to compare senna (and pyke) to other supports. those 2 champions should never have been released in the first place.

> [{quoted}](name=Rewt,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=kpXGrHl9,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2019-12-26T22:03:32.254+0000)
>
> Ok first things first. Senna (and pyke for that matter) are not supports.

Idk how we can have a conversation on the role with this fundamental flaw in your understanding of the topic.

Supports aren't defined by what they build. They're defined by *what they do.* You wouldn't say Sona isn't a support because she wants to buy mage items, no? Same thing with these two. Pyke creates picks, but focuses more on aggressive play making than catcher do, and Senna has much of her kit dedicated to back line supporting, even if it also doubles as back line damage. She also scales like complete ass, like most supports do.

If you don't like those champs...*whatever,* but it doesn't refute or even address the topic of the thread so why are you talking about it here?

Pyke's main function is an assassin who jerks off in the bot lane for a while. He isn't a support. He is an assassin who masquerades as a support.

Senna isn't a support. She is an ADC who masquerades as a support. 

Senna's purpose isn't to be a force multiplier for her team. Compare her to every other enchanter. Lulu does a small amount of poke with a focus on shielding her ADC and CCing the enemy. Yuumi is literally a force multiplier. Soraka heals, Slows, Roots, Silences. etc. These champs aren't independent agents. They exist to be a force multiplier for their team. Senna is an Independent agent. Her primary purpose is to be a secondary ADC who doesn't need gold funneling like standard ADC's to function. the only part of senna where I go "Oh yea that is actually a support ability" is her ult.

Pyke is an assassin. Pure and simple. While I don't think he is a support. He at least hides his true purpose better than senna. His Q is single target giving him poor wave clear, His E cant hit minions, His W is just a repositioning tool. While his purpose is to kill the opponent and due to the way he works, give full gold to his team in the process, He at least can be made an argument for why he is a support.

EDIT: So what im saying is. We SHOULD NOT be using Senna (or Pyke for that matter) as ideals for what supports should be like. They are not healthy for the game. So saying "Oh yea all enchanters except senna are boring" is a moot point because Sennar really isnt an enchanter. She is a marksman who is posing as one. Senna should be nerfed super hard to become more like the others. Nerf her Damage hard. Nerf her stats from her souls hard. Boost the healing and shielding. buff the movespeed on the semi invisibility. Make her a support not a marksman
